Tarzan.Action: Leads Jane and Boy in a playful underwater swimming game, demonstrating a fun and inclusive nature.
Engages in synchronized play with companions, showing friendliness and sincerity in interaction.
Leads a complex underwater swimming ballet game with Jane and Boy, performing graceful dives and synchronized movements with confidence and skill.
Leads Jane and Boy in synchronized underwater play, including follow-the-leader and aquatic routines.
Includes Jane and Boy in playful swimming activities, demonstrating patience and camaraderie.
Leads Jane and Boy through a complex underwater swimming routine with grace and coordination, maintaining rhythm and control.
Effectively uses the environment (Buli the elephant) as a central point for their underwater movements, demonstrating situational awareness.
Chases the giant turtle skillfully after Boy fails to catch it, showing quick decision-making and physical capability.
Playfully squirts water at Jane after asking if everyone is happy, grinning.
Reassures others by expressing happiness when others are happy (Buli, Cheeta, Jane).
Passively observes Boy playing with stones without interfering or scolding.
Calmly manages interactions between animals (Buli and Cheeta), showing control and understanding of their behavior.
Quickly identifies significance of shiny stones as gold nuggets alongside Jane, showing alertness and some knowledge.
Playfully squirts water at Jane, showing confidence and comfort in social interactions.
Shakes Cheeta upside down to help her cough out the swallowed nugget.
Grins and laughs with others after Cheeta swallows the nugget.
Focuses on getting food to share dinner rather than valuing gold.
Shakes Cheeta upside down to make her cough out the swallowed gold nugget.
Dives into the pool to catch a fish for food demonstrating swimming and hunting skills.
Struggles initially with the fish but persists until he successfully catches it.
Throws pomegranates to Buli and Cheeta as a friendly gesture while bringing fruit for the table.
Good-naturedly musses up Jane when talking about the airplane.
Watches Boy closely and comments 'Talk. Always talk.' showing mild impatience.
Carries and distributes pomegranates with ease and confidence, demonstrating physical capability and care.
Responds to Jane's explanation of civilization with a simple, direct comment about the airplane falling and redirects focus to dinner, showing a practical, no-nonsense attitude.
Watches the boy thoughtfully and comments 'Talk. Always talk.', indicating awareness and observational skill.
Does not engage deeply in the discussion about civilization; quickly shifts conversation to immediate needs (dinner).
Watches over Boy while he fetches caviar, interacts silently but attentively.
Constructs a wooden refrigerator with a clever cooling system using a bamboo trough and water curtain.
Watches the boy retrieving the caviar and the general food preparation, appears observant and calm.
Does not intervene when Buli is caught eating the pomegranates, showing tolerance or acceptance without conflict.
Laughs at Boy's attempt to chase hyena, engaging playfully with family.
Plucks a triple orchid and places it in Jane's hair, showing affection and thoughtfulness.
Intercepts egg and cracks it with a club, demonstrating physical skill and resourcefulness.
Laughs and interacts playfully with Jane and Boy, showing social confidence but not directly demonstrating competence.
Reaches up and plucks a triple orchid from a tree to give to Jane, showing attentiveness and knowledge of his environment.
Gives Jane a rock-crushing hug in a playful and affectionate manner.
Laughs and shares a warm, relaxed moment with Jane and Boy, engaging in light-hearted interaction.
Grins and embraces Jane playfully and confidently, showing ease and control in social interaction.
Relaxes grip when Jane shows discomfort, demonstrating sensitivity and emotional intelligence.
Engages in lighthearted, affectionate interaction, indicating comfort and social skill.
Boy writing a note explaining his absence to others, showing consideration.
Boy carefully trying to avoid disturbing sleeping Buli, showing kindness and gentleness.
Boy takes care to be stealthy and quiet to avoid harm or disturbance.
Quickly climbs tree to evade lion, uses vines skillfully to swing between trees and escape danger.
Shows awareness of danger and attempts to keep safe distance from lion.
Seems momentarily scared and startled when looking down at the lion.
Calmly swings across a dangerously unstable tree stretched across a chasm, showing awareness of peril and maintaining balance under pressure.
Successfully uses natural agility and quick decision-making to escape a pursuing lion repeatedly.
Relies on instinctual movement and resourcefulness in a life-threatening chase, demonstrating physical and mental capability.
Tries not to show fear or pain to comfort Cheeta after a dangerous crossing.
Watches out for Cheeta and communicates with him during danger and after escape.
Navigates a perilous crossing over a chasm on a fragile tree bridge despite dangerous conditions, successfully reaching the other side.
Remains composed and tries not to show pain after being seared, displaying emotional control.
Whistles relief after escape, indicating confidence in his survival and situational awareness.
Yells to Tumbo and plans to rescue him from the rhino by swinging on a vine.
Prepares to swing away from tree to help Tumbo, showing quick thinking and confidence.
Jumped out of the way just in time to avoid being run over by the charging rhino.
Demonstrated skill and quick thinking by grabbing Tumbo and swinging safely up into a tree to escape danger.
Calmly instructed Tumbo how to hold on to the vine as they swung away from the rhino.
Shows no direct interaction with Tumbo and Boy's exchange of friendship; remains an observer rather than participant.
While not explicitly described in this excerpt, Tarzan's presence and interaction with the animals and the situation with the rhino suggests his confidence and command in the jungle environment.
Initiates and emphasizes friendship with Tumbo, using linked fingers gesture and repeating 'friends' to communicate goodwill.
Expresses gladness about having a friend other than animals, showing openness and sincerity.
Follows Tumbo towards the village despite the ominous drums, indicating trust and solidarity.
Engages patiently and skillfully in communication with Tumbo despite language barriers, using gestures and simple words to establish friendship.
Recognizes danger promptly when hearing native drums and follows Tumbo cautiously toward the village, showing situational awareness.
Observes the dire situation silently and stays close with companions to avoid drawing attention; remains calm and attentive in a threatening environment.
Boy joins finger with Tumbo's finger gently and shows sympathy to Tumbo's grief, demonstrating calm presence under distressing circumstances.
Boy senses possible peril from witch doctor and crowd, contemplates flight but does not panic, showing situational awareness and cautiousness.
Boy struggles against being grabbed by warriors yet is held firmly, no mention of escape or overcoming threat.
No direct action from Tarzan in this excerpt; others attempt rescue while Tarzan is not mentioned as acting.
Introduces Tumbo as his friend to the white men, showing openness and friendly trust.
Invites Tumbo to accompany them, demonstrating inclusiveness and sincere regard for his companion.
Tarzan's call rings through the jungle, stopping a savage horde on their charge, causing them to flee.
Responds instantly to Boy's call, causing savages to flee peacefully.
Swings down to the village and immediately embraces Boy, showing concern for his well-being.
Reassures Boy about his mother and the situation gently, though with some sternness.
Uses a loud, commanding call to stop a hostile charge, causing savages to flee.
Swings swiftly and confidently through the trees to arrive timely in the village.
Shows concern and sharp observation when greeting the Boy, checking if he is all right.
Listens attentively, expression softens, then takes Elliott's hand.
Affectionately rubs Boy's head while acknowledging him as his son.
Likes O'Doul, takes his hand despite O'Doul wincing.
Saves lives of Elliott and group when they were in danger.
Initially does not shake Elliott's hand but observes carefully before warming up.
Shows controlled, calm demeanor and attentiveness when listening to explanations.
Engages positively with others after assessment, showing social intelligence.
Refuses to shake hands with men carrying machine guns and clearly expresses dislike of guns due to their killing of animals.
Clearly informs the men that they cannot cross the mountains because of ice and snow, demonstrating knowledge of terrain and conditions.
Offers an alternative route up an escarpment to reach the river in six days, warning of risks including men dying, showing realistic assessment and confidence in his knowledge.
Agrees matter-of-factly to help the men as a guide.
Avoids conflict by not escalating disputes about the route, remaining focused on practical matters.
Abruptly pulls O'Doul out of the truck in reaction to a clicking sound, showing alertness and physical decisiveness.
Mistakes the camera clicking for a weapon and initially reacts aggressively, showing a lack of understanding of modern technology.
Carefully scrutinizes the camera when puzzled, showing a willingness to investigate and learn.
Runs through the pictures quickly, indicating curiosity but possibly superficial understanding.
Takes the picture from Cheeta and returns it politely to O'Doul.
Speaks friendly to Cheeta, showing gentle interaction.
Tries the liquor offered by O'Doul, then reacts honestly by spitting it out and breaking the bottle.
Responds to O'Doul's comment with a friendly grin and light-hearted humor about the horn's noise.
Grins and slaps O'Doul on the back warmly, complimenting him.
Grins confidently and engages with O'Doul in friendly banter, showing social ease and self-assurance.
Continues on the trail alone after O'Doul is frozen with fear, indicating calmness and focus under potentially tense situations.
Allows Boy to enjoy pushing the horn and interact with Tumbo freely, without interrupting or reprimanding.
Does not intervene when Baroni harshly reprimands Boy for pushing the horn.
Maintains calm and composed demeanor despite others being nervous or scared (e.g., O'Doul's nervousness about the Hybird).
Others express disdain or annoyance about the expedition and Tarzan's role in it (Baroni's sarcasm, calling Tarzan 'super-savage' and implying the expedition is a circus act).
Calmly retrieves and shows gold nuggets despite the indifferent or distracted reactions of others.
Tries to demonstrate the value of gold to companions who ignore or dismiss it, showing persistence and awareness.
Does not display overt leadership or assertiveness in gaining others' attention or managing their reactions in this excerpt.
Not present or referenced in this excerpt; no direct actions or statements by Tarzan.

Carefully watches Elliott after the climb, remaining alert to potential danger.
Grins and roughs up Boy playfully, showing confidence and ease in social interaction.

Stands over Boy, Tumbo, and Cheeta watching them quietly but somewhat aloof.

Remains calm and aloof while watching the moving pictures, showing steady composure.
Asks repeatedly 'Why?' regarding the speed and purpose of the train, failing to grasp the practical advantages quickly.
Sharply tells Boy it is time for bed, despite Boy's protests.
Sharply tells Boy to go to bed despite Boy's protests, showing firm control and decisiveness.
Is stunned along with Jane by the news about gold but maintains silence, indicating thoughtful internal processing.
Defends the country as his home and stands firmly against Medford's claim, showing protective and sincere attachment.
Reacts with darkened face, about to speak but is interrupted, suggesting restraint instead of confrontation.
Advances fiercely on Medford to defend his claim to the land confidently and asserts his authority.
Tenses up and is silent when confronted with the gold nugget revelation, showing momentary hesitation before speaking.
Firmly insists that the land is their home, defending his territory calmly but resolutely.
Tells Jane to go home, calling her with concern.
Moves away from confrontation when Jane asks him to stop, showing restraint.
Advances fiercely on Medford who gives way before him, asserting control over his territory confidently.
Directs Jane firmly to go home at an appropriate moment, showing decisiveness and protection.
Steps back a pace when Jane pleads but remains tense, indicating controlled restraint and situational awareness.
Goes directly to the Boy's bedside to check on him, showing concern for his wellbeing.
Listens and observes quietly with Jane, allowing her to comfort the Boy without interrupting.
Goes directly to check on the boy at bedside and vigilantly watches over him without disturbing his sleep.
Does not overreact or act hastily despite the boy’s feverish mumbling, choosing to wait until morning to address the boy’s concerns.
Swings down to join party promptly, attentive to tension in group.
Keeps knowledge about gold source discreet, allowing others to express excitement and greed.
No evident expression of greed or taking advantage of gold discovery.
Immediately stops Medford from using a gun by physically disarming him and breaking the gun to prevent violence.
Firmly insists that Jane and the Boy remain at their home and emphasizes the safety of his family over the prospect of wealth.
Impatiently interrupts Medford's arguments about wealth, signaling intolerance toward greed and deception.
Responds to tension with physical force and assertiveness, yet acts protectively towards family and home.
Interrupts negotiations assertively and decisively to protect his home and loved ones.
Physically disarms Medford quickly and effectively, showing strength and control of the situation.
Confidently asserts the importance of his home and family over greed or wealth.
Maintains control of the adversaries by following behind them as they leave, signaling dominance.
Interrupts Baroni and Medford impatiently to stop their greedy behavior, dismantles a gun to protect Jane and Boy, and asserts they are at home there.
Shows genuine concern for O'Doul’s illness, immediately checks on him despite ongoing tension about the treasure.
Interrupts impatiently and decisively orders Baroni and Medford to leave, demonstrating clear command over the situation.
Overpowers Medford when he tries to use a gun, disarms him quickly and destroys the weapon, preventing escalation.
Prioritizes the safety and home of Jane and Boy over the lure of gold, showing sound judgment and emotional intelligence.
Follows Baroni and Medford to ensure they leave the river area, maintaining control of the situation.
Steps forward to inquire about O'Doul's illness and immediately investigates by entering the tent, showing initiative and concern.
Examines O'Doul on the cot and appears to assess his condition, indicating practical knowledge and attention to detail.
Gives O'Doul a cup of freshly squeezed juice as medicine and speaks gently to encourage him.
Responds promptly to O'Doul's dire condition with care and vitality.

Swiftly enters, quickly prepares and administers medicine to O'Doul, showing timely and effective caregiving.
Responds with gentle reassurance to O'Doul, indicating confidence and skill in handling a delicate situation.
Suddenly stiffens and leaves tent after Cheeta's warning, demonstrating alertness and quick reaction to potential danger or important information.
Gives O'Doul juice when he is unwell, speaks gently to him.
Shows sudden concern and quickly leaves after hearing Cheeta’s urgent jabbering.
Calmly and swiftly examines the Boy who is very ill, reassuring Jane with gentle words.
Gently pushes Jane away when she clings to him in panic, to get medicine for the Boy.
Calmly diagnoses Boy's illness as Ubardi plague upon quick examination.
Swiftly decides to get medicine to cure Boy, showing confidence and decisiveness.
Gently pushes Jane away to allow him to act effectively, maintaining control in a crisis.
Expresses obvious dislike toward Baroni and Medford, accusing them of lying.
Puts his arm affectionately around Jane to comfort her during the boy's illness.

Tarzan openly shows dislike and distrust toward Baroni and Medford, accusing them of lying without constructive engagement or explanation.
Puts his arm affectionately around Jane to comfort her in distress.
Insists on going himself to fetch medicine to save Boy despite initial hesitation.
Quietly agrees to go after Jane's emotional plea, showing responsiveness and care.
Insists on staying to care for Boy initially, showing confidence in his own cure knowledge but also hesitation about the proposed medicine trip.
Decides to go for the medicine after Jane’s emotional appeal and the urgency of the situation, demonstrating willingness to act amid pressure and responsibility.
Moves quickly and with focus to attend Boy before departing, showing care and purposeful action.
Swings out on a vine holding Tumbo and lands successfully, then quickly races across clearing.
Runs into scene and swiftly climbs to the lending of his house.
Rushes inside the house and calls urgently for Jane and the boys as he searches.
Hurts Baroni physically by seizing his throat in desperation to learn the whereabouts of Jane and Boy.
Loosens his grip when Baroni becomes limp and unable to respond, showing some restraint.
Reacting immediately and physically by seizing Baroni's throat upon suspicion, showing decisiveness and confidence in stressful interrogation.
Loosening grip on Baroni once realizing the man is choking, indicating self-control and situational awareness.
Struggling internally to accept potential defeat, hesitating to realize the truth about his family’s whereabouts.
Repeatedly demanding clear information about Jane, Boy, and Elliott, showing persistence and clarity of purpose.
Carries out his end of the bargain despite hesitation and apparent defeat.
Fiercely impatient, shoves Baroni out of the way to quickly reach Jane and Boy.
Seizes a giant vine and attempts a daring swing over a 70-80 feet wide, 300 feet deep chasm, showing physical skill and courage.
Starts swing from a considerable distance from the rim, displaying confidence and calculated risk-taking.
Looks back in surprise at the machine gun fire while swinging, indicating momentary distraction or underestimation of danger.
Falling as vine is cut by bullets, losing grip and failing to secure passage across chasm, showing a setback or limitation in successfully navigating the obstacle.
Momentum carries him to a ledge 40 feet below rim, and he falls into thick brush that breaks his fall and conceals him, indicating quick physical adaptation and use of environment to his advantage.
Swings over a chasm despite active gunfire, adjusts to the broken vine and uses momentum to land safely on a ledge below, concealed by brush.
Lies unconscious on his face, requiring others to react and take action.
Survives an attack that others believe should have finished him, showing resilience and implied resourcefulness.
Does not appear directly in the excerpt but others express uncertainty about his status and capabilities, indicating he is a formidable presence.
Is reported dead after an accident swinging on a vine, which Boy immediately doubts, showing Tarzan's reputed carefulness and skill.
No direct action shown in the excerpt, but the implied trust and confidence of those around him indicates competence.
No direct action or statement by Tarzan in the excerpt; mainly others acting under stress and confusion.

Does not directly appear in excerpt to act, but implied presence shows dominance as lion reacts to others' less competent behavior.
Calls out orders in jungle language to Timba and Buli to push a tree over a chasm to create a bridge; coordinates animals' efforts skillfully and confidently.
Commands animals (Timba, Buli, Cheeta, Tumbo) effectively to push over a tall tree to bridge a chasm, demonstrating leadership and coordination.
Remains calm and focused while observing the dangerous situation from a dizzying height, showing confidence and situational awareness.
Quickly instructs companions to get vines to potentially create a bridge or safety device, showing quick thinking and adaptability.
Does not panic despite the tree tipping and breaking off, trusting the animals and following through with the plan.
Uses jungle language to coordinate with Tumbo and directs the effort to create a rope setup to aid O'Doul.
Involves and trusts animals (Tumbo, Timba) to work together toward a common goal.
Throws his knife accurately across the ravine enabling Tumbo to use it to cut vines, showing strategic planning and precise execution.
Communicates in jungle language to coordinate with Tumbo, demonstrating effective leadership and coordination.
Calls out instructions clearly from the other side of the chasm to Timba, orchestrating a complex rope and sapling mechanism successfully.
Leads captives away from execution and remains calm amid chaos and threat.
Strangles native underwater but releases him when crocodile appears and swims away, leaving natives struggling.
Strangles a native underwater effectively, displaying physical control and combat skill.
Releases native promptly when crocodile appears and swims away swiftly, showing situational awareness and survival instinct.
Avoids spears thrown from approaching canoes by swimming skillfully underwater.
Breaks surface from water out of spear throw range, indicating awareness and survival skill in dangerous surroundings.
Looks quickly around, shows tension on seeing approaching enemy fleet, demonstrating alertness and situational awareness.
Gives his call to summon help or signal others despite approaching danger from hostile savages.
Continues calling and does not show panic or aggression, indicating calm and controlled behavior.
Submerges underwater to avoid danger, giving indication of self-preservation but also not provoking unnecessary violence.

Submerges underwater after completing his call to avoid incoming spears, showing physical skill and tactical thinking.
Swims to rescue boy bound and sinking in river despite danger from crocodiles and savages.
Races confidently and skillfully through water, swimming at top speed downstream toward the canoes despite the presence of danger such as crocodiles and panicking natives.
Swims to Jane, draws her down, cuts her bonds with help from Boy, and swims them off underwater to safety.
Grapples multiple natives underwater, disposes of them skillfully and swiftly.

Swims confidently and effectively under water, rescuing Jane and cutting her bonds despite danger.
Swims underwater skillfully with Jane and Boy, surfaces to assess the situation after the battle.
Relaxed, happy, and laughs together with Boy and Jane at O'Doul's antics.

Relaxes and laughs at O'Doul's antics, remaining calm and confident in contrast to others who panic or lose balance.
